paragraphs.text:
%md
# Setup
Be sure to read the General Notes section above before starting the exercises

msg.data:
Setup

Be sure to read the General Notes section above before starting the exercises

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Verifying Your Cluster Services

Your exercise environment host should be running and ready for you.

msg.data:
Verifying Your Cluster Services

When you start or restart your exercise environment host, the cluster services will automatically start. It takes about five minutes for all services to start up fully.

paragraphs.title: 1 - Confirm that all required services are working
paragraphs.text:
%md
Confirm that all required services are running, indicated by a green dot next to the service name.
Required services: HDFS, Hive, Kafka, Spark, YARN, Zookeeper.

msg.data:
Confirm that all required services are noted as “good.”
Required services: HDFS, Hive, Kafka, Spark, YARN, Zookeeper.

paragraphs.title: 2 - Toubleshooting unresponsive services
paragraphs.text:
%md
If any of the required services are not running, indicated by a red dot next to the service name, restart it by clicking on the service name, clicking on the `Actions` menu, and selecting `Restart Service`.
*Your exercise environment is now ready.*

msg.data:
If any of the required services are “bad”, wait a minute or two and try again. If they
are still not running correct, try restarting all the services by running the following
script:

$ start-cluster.sh

Wait until the script completes and then check the health again.
Your exercise environment is now ready.

paragraphs.title: Stopping Your Remote Host
paragraphs.text:
%md
### Stopping Your Remote host

Your remote host will be shut down at the end of class, but it will continue to be accessible to you for a limited time after that.

In order to minimize your usage of the limited time available, your remote host will be automatically shut down after thirty minutes of idle time. You can also stop it manually by clicking on the `...` at the top of the Services menu on the left, then select `Stop All`.

msg.data:
Stopping Your Remote host

Your remote host will be shut down at the end of class, but it will continue to be
accessible to you for a limited time after that.

In order to minimize your usage of the limited time available, your remote host will be
automatically shut down after thirty minutes of idle time. You can also stop it manually.

To shut down your environment, click the stop button (a square) in the toolbar at the
top of the remote desktop display.

*** Insert image here***

Follow the instructions above in the Starting Your Remote Host section to restart your
environment.

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Result
**You have now:** You have now started your exercise environment and the cluster on which you will do the course exercises.

---

msg.data:
Result

You have now: You have now started your exercise environment and the cluster on which you will do the course exercises.

paragraphs.text:
%md
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Hortonworks Apache Spark Tutorials](http://hortonworks.com/tutorials/#tuts-developers) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Hortonworks Community Connection (HCC)](https://community.hortonworks.com/spaces/85/data-science.html?type=question) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Hortonworks Apache Spark Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/spark-overview/content/analyzing_data_with_apache_spark.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Hortonworks Apache Zeppelin Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/zeppelin-overview/content/overview.html) - official Zeppelin documentation.

msg.data:
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

  1. Hortonworks Apache Spark Tutorials are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
  2. Hortonworks Community Connection (HCC) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
  3. Hortonworks Apache Spark Docs - official Spark documentation.
  4. Hortonworks Apache Zeppelin Docs - official Zeppelin documentation.
